title: Insights Into vEM and Correlative Nanoscopy At UIUC
content: Volume electron microscopy (vEM) [1] is a powerful technique to study the 3D architecture of cell and tissue volumes at electron microscopy resolutions from unicellular organisms such as archaea cells to multicellular organisms such as yeast, plants and mammals. Data from several vEM projects will be presented, demonstrating the variety of projects benefiting from vEM
